title: Batch Schema
description: FIRE schema for representing bulk collections of bank objects.

name.description: A unique identifier for the data batch

count.description: Number of records in this batch

data.description: An array of data items of a single type

links.description: An array describing the page structure of the full data batch

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Account Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: An Account represents a financial account that describes the funds that a customer has entrusted to a financial institution in the form of deposits or credit balances.

id.description: The unique identifier for the account within the financial institution.

date.description: The observation or value date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

acc_fv_change_before_taxes.description: Accumulated change in fair value before taxes.

accrued_interest.description: The accrued interest since the last payment date and due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

arrears_balance.description: The balance of the capital amount that is considered to be in arrears (for overdrafts/credit cards). Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

balance.description: The contractual balance on the date and in the currency given. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

base_rate.description: The base rate represents the basis of the rate on the balance at the given date as agreed in the terms of the account.

behavioral_curve_id.description: The unique identifier for the behavioral curve used by the financial institution.

break_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be broken (by either party). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

call_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be called (by the customer). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

country_code.description: Two-letter country code for account location/jurisdiction. In accordance with ISO 3166-1.

cost_center_code.description: The organizational unit or sub-unit to which costs/profits are booked.

currency_code.description: Actual currency of the Account in accordance with ISO 4217 standards. It should be consistent with balance, accrued_interest, guarantee_amount and other monetary amounts.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the customer that owns the account.

end_date.description: The end or maturity date of the account. Format should be YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601

encumbrance_amount.description: The amount of the account that is encumbered by potential future commitments or legal liabilities. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

encumbrance_type.description: The type of the encumbrance causing the encumbrance_amount.

fvh_level.description: Fair value hierarchy category according to IFRS 13.93 (b)

first_payment_date.description: The first payment date for interest payments.

guarantee_amount.description: The amount of the account that is guaranteed under a Government Deposit Guarantee Scheme. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

guarantee_scheme.description: The Government Deposit Scheme scheme under which the guarantee_amount is guaranteed.

impairment_amount.description: The impairment amount is the allowance set aside by the firm that accounts for the event that the asset becomes impaired in the future.

insolvency_rank.description: The insolvency ranking as per the national legal framework of the reporting institution.

last_payment_date.description: The final payment date for interest payments, often coincides with end_date.

ledger_code.description: The internal ledger code or line item name.

limit_amount.description: The minimum balance the customer can go overdrawn in their account.

next_payment_date.description: The next date at which interest will be paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

next_withdrawal_date.description: The next date at which customer is allowed to withdraw money from this account.

on_balance_sheet.description: Is the account or deposit reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

prev_payment_date.description: The most recent previous date at which interest was paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

purpose.description: The purpose for which the account was created or is being used.

rate.description: The full interest rate applied to the account balance in percentage terms. Note that this therefore includes the base_rate (ie. not the spread).

rate_type.description: Describes the type of interest rate applied to the account.

reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the account resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

start_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product commences. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

status.description: Describes if the Account is active or been cancelled.

type.description: This is the type of the account with regards to common regulatory classifications.

trade_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product terms are agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

uk_funding_type.description: Funding type calculated according to BIPRU 12.5/12.6

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

withdrawal_penalty.description: This is the penalty incurred by the customer for an early withdrawal on this account. An early withdrawal is defined as a withdrawal prior to the next_withdrawal_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

count.description: Describes the number of accounts aggregated into a single row.

minimum_balance_eur.description: Indicates the minimum balance, in Euros, of each account within the aggregate. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

next_repricing_date.description: The date on which the interest rate of the account will be re-calculated. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

risk_weight_std.description: The standardised approach risk weight represented as a decimal/float such that 1.5% is 0.015.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: The accounting treatment in accordance with IAS/IFRS9 accounting principles.
Is the data an asset, a liability, or equity on the firm's balance sheet?
Two-letter country code as defined according to ISO 3166-1 plus ISO allowed, user-assignable codes (AA, QM to QZ, XA to XZ, and ZZ).
Currency in accordance with ISO 4217 standards plus CNH for practical considerations.
The credit conversion factor that indicates the proportion of the undrawn amount that would be drawn down on default.
The recognition stage for the impairment/expected credit loss of the product.
The type of portfolio in which the instrument is held.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Collateral Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: Data schema to define collateral (currently can reference loans or accounts).

id.description: The unique identifier for the collateral within the financial institution.

loan_ids.description: The unique identifiers for the loans within the financial institution.

account_ids.description: The unique identifier/s for the account/s within the financial institution.

charge.description: Lender charge on collateral, 1 indicates first charge, 2 second and so on. 0 indicates a combination of charge levels.

encumbrance_amount.description: The amount of the collateral that is encumbered by potential future commitments or legal liabilities. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

encumbrance_type.description: The type of the encumbrance causing the encumbrance_amount.

end_date.description: The end date for recognition of the collateral

source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

start_date.description: The start date for recognition of the collateral

type.description: The collateral type defines the form of the collateral provided

value.description: The valuation as used by the bank for the collateral on the value_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

value_date.description: The timestamp that the collateral was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

vol_adj.description: The volatility adjustment appropriate to the collateral.

vol_adj_fx.description: The volatility adjustment appropriate to currency mismatch.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Customer Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: Data schema to define a customer or legal entity related to a financial product or transaction.

annual_debit_turnover.description: The annual debit turnover in the business account of the entity. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

currency_code.description: Currency in accordance with ISO 4217. It should be consistent with annual_debit_turnover and incurred_cva.

clearing_threshold.description: Status of the clearing threshold as defined in EMIR

incurred_cva.description: The amount of credit valuation adjustements being recognised by the institution as an incurred write-down, calculated without taking into account any offsetting debit value adjustment attributed to the firm's own credit risk, that has been already excluded from own funds.

product_count.description: The number of active products/trades this customer has with the firm.

risk_profile.description: The evaluation of the customer's willingness and/or capacity to take on financial risk.

start_date.description: The date that the customer first became a customer. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

status.description: The status of the relationship with the customer from the firm's point of view.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Entity Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: Data schema to define a person or legal entity.

id.description: The unique identifier for the person or legal entity within the financial institution.

count.description: Describes the number of entities represented by this record. eg. joint customers should have a count > 1.

country_code.description: The person or entity country of residence. Two-letter country code as defined according to ISO 3166-1.

credit_impaired.description: Flag to determine if the entity credit quality is impaired.

cqs_standardised.description: The credit quality step for standardised approach.

cqs_irb.description: The credit quality step for internal ratings based approach.

intra_group.description: Flag to indicate that this should be considered an intra-group entity.

lei_code.description: The LEI code for the legal entity (for corporates).

legal_entity_name.description: The official legal name of the entity.

name.description: The name of the person or legal entity to be used for display and reference purposes.

parent_id.description: The unique identifier for the ultimate parent of the person or legal entity.

reporting_relationship.description: Relationship to reporting entity. See: relationship.

risk_group_id.description: The unique identifier for the group representing a single risk entity where no relationship of control exists

risk_group_id_2.description: The secondary identifier for the secondary group representing a single risk entity where no relationship of control exists

risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the security resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

sic_code.description: The UK SIC 2007 standard industry and sector classification.

ssic_code.description: The Singaporean standard industry and sector classification.

source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

type.description: The designated financial or legal entity category this person or legal entity falls under

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

national_reporting_code.description: Unique identifier established by the national reporting system

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Derivative Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: A derivative is a contract which derives its value from an underlying reference index, security or asset.

id.description: The unique identifier for the derivative within the financial institution.

date.description: The observation or effective date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

deal_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution for the deal to which this derivative belongs.

accrued_interest.description: The accrued interest since the last payment date and due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

balance.description: Outstanding amount including accrued interest. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

base_rate.description: The base rate represents the basis of the rate on the balance at the given date as agreed in the terms of the financial product.

break_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be broken (by either party). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

call_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be called (by the customer). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

cost_center_code.description: The organizational unit or sub-unit to which costs/profits are booked.

csa_id.description: The unique identifier of the credit support annex for this derivative

currency_code.description: Actual currency of the underlying reference index, security or asset for the derivative in accordance with ISO 4217 standards. It should be consistent with balance, accrued_interest, guarantee_amount and other monetary amounts.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the customer for this product.

fvh_level.description: Fair value hierarchy category according to IFRS 13.93 (b)

first_payment_date.description: The first payment date for interest payments.

gamma.description: Second-order price sensitivity to the underlying or rate of change of the delta.

impairment_amount.description: The impairment amount for a security is the allowance set aside by the firm for losses.

implied_vol.description: Options: implied volatility used to compute mtm and greeks.

initial_margin.description: Upfront margin posted/received for the trade. Monetary type as integer number of cents.

insolvency_rank.description: The insolvency ranking as per the national legal framework of the reporting institution.

last_exercise_date.description: The last date on which an option can be exercised. For European options, it is the option exercise date

last_payment_date.description: The final payment date for interest payments, often coincides with end_date.

ledger_code.description: The internal ledger code or line item name.

leg_type.description: Describe the payoff type of the derivative leg.

mna_id.description: The unique identifier of the Master Netting Agreement for this derivative

mtm_clean.description: The mark-to-market value of the derivative excluding interest. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

mtm_dirty.description: The mark-to-market value of the derivative including interest. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

next_exercise_date.description: The next date at which the option can be exercised.

next_payment_amount.description: The amount that will need to be paid at the next_payment_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

next_payment_date.description: The next date at which interest will be paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

next_receive_amount.description: The amount that is expected to be received at the next_receive_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

next_receive_date.description: The next date at which interest will be received or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

next_reset_date.description: The date on which the periodic payment term and conditions of a contract agreement are reset/re-established.

notional_amount.description: The notional value is the total value with regard to a derivative's underlying index, security or asset at its spot price in accordance with the specifications (i.e. leverage) of the derivative product. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

on_balance_sheet.description: Is the derivative reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

prev_payment_date.description: The most recent previous date at which interest was paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

position.description: Specifies the market position, i.e. long or short, of the derivative leg

product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

purpose.description: The purpose for which the derivative is being held.

rate.description: The full interest rate applied to the derivative notional in percentage terms. Note that this therefore includes the base_rate (ie. not the spread).

reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

country_code.description: Two-letter country code for derivative location/jurisdiction. In accordance with ISO 3166-1.

risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the derivative product resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

settlement_type.description: The type of settlement for the contract.

source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

start_date.description: Contract effective or commencement date; security issue date. Format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

theta.description: Price sensitivity with respect to time.

type.description: This is the type of the derivative with regards to common regulatory classifications.

trade_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product terms are agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

underlying_currency_code.description: Currency of the underlying which should be in line with ISO 4217 standards.

underlying_derivative_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the underlying reference derivative for this derivative.

underlying_index.description: The name of a derivative contract underlying which can be used for all derivative asset classes (e.g. interest rate index, credit index, equity index

underlying_index_tenor.description: The designated maturity of the underlying interest rate index used in the underlying_index property for interest rate derivatives

underlying_issuer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the underlying reference issuer for this derivative.

underlying_security_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the underlying reference security for this derivative.

underlying_quantity.description: Number of underlying units related to the underlying_price

underlying_strike.description: Strike price of the option, which is compared to the underlying price on the option exercise date.

strike.description: Strike price of the option, which is compared to the underlying price on the option exercise date.

value_date.description: The timestamp that the derivative was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: The asset class to which the derivative belongs.
The market identifier code as defined by the International Standards Organisation.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Derivative Cash Flow Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: A derivative cash flow where two parties exchange cash flows (or assets) derived from an underlying reference index, security or financial instrument.

id.description: The unique identifier for the derivative within the financial institution.

date.description: The observation or effective date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

accrued_interest.description: The accrued interest/premium due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

asset_liability.description: A derivative cash flow exchange that results in a net positive value after the transaction is an asset on the firm's balance sheet. A derivative cash flow exchange that results in a net negative value after the transaction is a liability on the firm's balance sheet.

balance.description: The contractual balance due on the payment date in the currency given. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

csa_id.description: The unique identifier of the credit support annex for this derivative cash flow

currency_code.description: Actual currency of the security in accordance with ISO 4217 standards. It should be consistent with balance, accrued_interest, guarantee_amount and other monetary amounts.

derivative_id.description: Unique identifier to the derivative to which this cash flow relates

forward_rate.description: Rate used to set a variable cash flow on the reset_date

leg.description: The type of the payment leg.

mna_id.description: The unique identifier of the Master Netting Agreement for this derivative cash flow.

mtm_clean.description: The mark-to-market value of the derivative cash flow excluding interest/premium/coupons. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

mtm_dirty.description: The mark-to-market value of the derivative cash flow including interest/premium/coupons. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

notional_amount.description: The notional value is the total value with regard to a derivative's underlying index, security or asset at its spot price in accordance with the specifications (i.e. leverage) of the derivative product. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

on_balance_sheet.description: Is the financial product reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

payment_date.description: The timestamp that the cash flow will occur or was paid. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

purpose.description: The purpose for which the derivative cash flow is calculated

reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

reset_date.description: Date on which a variable cash flow amount is set. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

settlement_type.description: The type of settlement for the contract.

source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

trade_date.description: The date that the derivative cash flow terms were agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

value_date.description: The timestamp that the cash flow was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Exchange Rate Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: An Exchange Rate represents the conversion rate between two currencies.

id.description: The unique identifier for the exchange rate within the financial institution.

date.description: The observation or value date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

base_currency_code.description: The base currency in accordance with ISO 4217 standards.

quote.description: The amount of the quote currency received in exchange for 1 unit of the base currency.

quote_currency_code.description: The quoted currency in accordance with ISO 4217 standards.

source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Guarantor Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: Data schema to define a guarantor for a security.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Issuer Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: Data schema to define an issuer for a security.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Loan Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: Data schema defining the characteristics of a loan product.

id.description: The unique identifier for the loan within the financial institution.

acc_fv_change_before_taxes.description: Accumulated change in fair value before taxes.

acc_fv_change_credit_risk.description: Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk.

accrued_interest_balance.description: The accrued interest due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

administration.description: How the loan was administered by the lender.

arrears_arrangement.description: The arrangement the lender has made with the borrower regarding the amount referenced in the arrears_balance.

arrears_balance.description: The balance of the loan or capital amount that is considered to be in arrears. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

balance.description: The balance of the loan or capital still to be repaid. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

base_rate.description: The base rate represents the basis of the repayment rate on the borrowed funds at the given date as agreed in the terms of the loan.

behavioral_curve_id.description: The unique identifier for the behavioral curve used by the financial institution.

cost_center_code.description: The organizational unit or sub-unit to which costs/profits are booked.

country_code.description: Two-letter country code for product location/jurisdiction. In accordance with ISO 3166-1.

cum_recoveries.description: The total amount recovered since the date of default of the instrument.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the customer.

customers.description: The list of customers for this loan

id.description: The unique identifier for the customer/s within the financial institution.

income_amount.description: The reference income used for the customer(s) for this loan. Monetary type represented as an integer number of cents/pence.

encumbrance_amount.description: The amount of the loan that is encumbered by potential future commitments or legal liabilities. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

encumbrance_end_date.description: Date encumbrance amount goes to zero. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601

encumbrance_type.description: The type of the encumbrance causing the encumbrance_amount.

facility_currency_code.description: The currency of the credit facility if not the same as loan currency_code.

fvh_level.description: Fair value hierarchy category according to IFRS 13.93 (b)

first_payment_date.description: The first payment date for interest payments.

guarantee_amount.description: The amount of the loan that is guaranteed by the guarantor. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

guarantor_id.description: The unique identifier for the guarantor of the loan.

impairment_amount.description: The impairment amount for a loan is the allowance for loan impairments set aside by the firm that accounts for the event that the loan becomes impaired in the future.

impairment_type.description: The loss event resulting in the impairment of the loan.

interest_repayment_frequency.description: Repayment frequency of the loan interest, if different from principal.

issuer_id.description: The unique identifier for the issuer of the loan.

last_payment_date.description: The final payment date for interest payments, often coincides with end_date.

ledger_code.description: The internal ledger code or line item name.

limit_amount.description: The total credit limit on the loan. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

lnrf_amount.description: The total amount of non-recourse funding linked to the loan. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

movement.description: The movement parameter describes how the loan arrived to the firm.

next_payment_date.description: The next date at which interest will be paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

notional_amount.description: The original notional amount of the loan. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

on_balance_sheet.description: Is the loan reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

originator_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the originator of the loan product.

originator_type.description: The type of financial institution that acted as the originator of the loan product.

prev_payment_date.description: The most recent previous date at which interest was paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

provision_amount.description: The amount of reserves that is provisioned by the financial institution to cover the potential loss on the loan. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

provision_type.description: The provision type parameter details the provisions the issuing firm has allocated to cover potential losses from issuing a loan.

purpose.description: The underlying reason the borrower has requested the loan.

rate.description: The full interest rate applied to the loan balance. Note that for tracker rates this includes the benchmark (ie. not the credit spread). Percentages represented as a decimal/float, so 1.5 implies 1.5%.

rate_type.description: Describes the type of interest rate applied to the loan.

ref_income_amount.description: The reference income used for the customer(s) for this loan. Monetary type represented as an integer number of cents/pence.

regulated.description: Is this loan regulated or unregulated?

repayment_type.description: Repayment type of the loan refers to whether the customer will be repaying capital + interest, just interest or a combination of the two.

reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the product resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

risk_weight_std.description: The standardised approach risk weight represented as a decimal/float such that 1.5% is 0.015.

risk_weight_irb.description: The internal risk weight represented as a decimal/float such that 1.5% is 0.015.

secured.description: Is this loan secured or unsecured?

source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

start_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product commences. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

status.description: Describes if the loan is active or been cancelled.

trade_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product terms are agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

type.description: The form of the loan product administered by the financial institution, with regards to common regulatory classifications.

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

vol_adj.description: The volatility adjustment appropriate to the exposure.

count.description: Describes the number of loans aggregated into a single row.

minimum_balance_eur.description: Indicates the minimum balance, in Euros, of each loan within the aggregate.

next_repricing_date.description: The date on which the interest rate of the loan will be re-calculated. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Loan Transaction Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: A Loan Transaction is an event that has an impact on a loan, typically the balance.

id.description: The unique identifier for the loan transaction within the financial institution.

amount.description: The size of the transaction in the loan transaction event. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

loan_id.description: The unique identifier for the affected loan/s within the financial institution.

source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

type.description: The type of impact on the balance of the loan.

value_date.description: The timestamp that the transaction was valued or took place. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.title: Security Schema
https:__raw.githubusercontent.com_SuadeL.description: A security represents a tradable financial instrument held or financed by an institution for investment or collateral.

id.description: The unique identifier for the security within the financial institution.

date.description: The observation or effective date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

acc_fv_change_before_taxes.description: Accumulated change in fair value before taxes.

acc_fv_change_credit_risk.description: Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk.

accrued_interest.description: The accrued interest since the last payment date and due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as an integer number of cents/pence.

asset_liability.description: Is the security (valued at either amortised cost or fair value) an asset or a liability on the firm's balance sheet.

capital_tier.description: The capital tiers based on own funds requirements.

cb_haircut.description: The haircut as determined by the firm's central bank

cost_center_code.description: The organizational unit or sub-unit to which costs/profits are booked.

balance.description: Outstanding amount including accrued interest. Monetary integer number of cents/pence.

base_rate.description: The base rate represents the basis of the rate on the balance at the given date as agreed in the terms of the financial product.

break_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be broken (by either party). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

call_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be called (by the customer). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

country_code.description: Two-letter country code for security location/jurisdiction. In accordance with ISO 3166-1.

cqs_standardised.description: The credit quality step for standardised approach.

cqs_irb.description: The credit quality step for internal ratings based approach.

csa_id.description: The unique identifier of the credit support annex this security falls under. Typically where used as derivatives collateral.

currency_code.description: Actual currency of the security in accordance with ISO 4217 standards. It should be consistent with balance, accrued_interest, guarantee_amount and other monetary amounts.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the customer for this product.

deal_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the deal for this product that links it to other products of the same or different type.

encumbrance_amount.description: The amount of the security that is encumbered by potential future commitments or legal liabilities such as within a repo pool. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

fvh_level.description: Fair value hierarchy category according to IFRS 13.93 (b)

first_payment_date.description: The first payment date for interest payments.

guarantor_id.description: The unique identifier for the guarantor within the financial institution.

guarantee_start_date.description: The first day the security became guaranteed by the guarantor. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601

hqla_class.description: What is the HQLA classification of this security?

impairment_amount.description: The impairment amount for a security is the allowance set aside by the firm for losses.

insolvency_rank.description: The insolvency ranking as per the national legal fraamework of the reporting institution.

index_composition.description: Constituents and their proportion in an index.

reference_id.description: The reference security id for the weight.

weight.description: The proportion of the reference in the index. It is recorded in decimal format.

isin_code.description: The unique International Securities Identification Number for the security according to ISO 6166.

issuer_id.description: The unique identifier for the issuer within the financial institution.

issue_size.description: The size of the issue denominated in the original currency of the security

issue_date.description: The date on which the security is issued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

last_payment_date.description: The final payment date for interest payments, often coincides with end_date or the maturity date

ledger_code.description: The internal ledger code or line item name.

maturity_date.description: The date on which the principal repayment of the security is due. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

mna_id.description: The unique identifier of the Master Netting Agreement this security falls under. Typically where used as derivatives collateral.

movement.description: The movement parameter describes how the security arrived to the firm.

mtm_clean.description: The mark-to-market value of the security excluding interest. Monetary number of cents/pence.

mtm_dirty.description: The mark-to-market value of the security including interest. Monetary number of cents/pence.

next_payment_date.description: The next date at which interest will be paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

notional_amount.description: The notional value is the total amount of a security's underlying asset at its spot price. Monetary number of cents.

on_balance_sheet.description: Is the security reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

prev_payment_date.description: The most recent previous date at which interest was paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

purpose.description: The purpose for which the security is being held.

rate.description: The full interest rate applied to the security notional in percentage terms. Note that this therefore includes the base_rate (ie. not the spread).

rehypothecation.description: Can the security be rehypothecated by the borrower?

reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the security resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

seniority.description: The seniority of the security in the event of sale or bankruptcy of the issuer.

sft_type.description: The sft_type parameter defines the transaction mechanism conducted for the SFT for this security product.

source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

start_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product commences. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

status.description: Provides additional information regarding the status of the security.

stress_change.description: The level of variation on the security's price or haircut or during a 30 day calendar market stress period in percentage terms

type.description: This is the type of the security with regards to common regulatory classifications.

trade_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product terms are agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

transferable.description: Can the security be transferred between parties or negotiated on the capital market?

value_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

next_repricing_date.description: The date on which the interest rate of the security will be re-calculated. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.
